senses.sense_definition: A clever argument that seems true at first but is actually false and used to deceive people.

examples.text: The lawyer's defense relied on a subtle <w>sophism</w> that confused the jury.
She realized that his explanation was nothing more than a <w>sophism</w> intended to hide his mistake.

senses.sense_definition: The philosophy and teaching methods of the Sophists in ancient Greece, often associated with clever but misleading arguments.

examples.text: Ancient <w>sophism</w> focused heavily on rhetoric and the art of persuasion.
The professor explained how Greek <w>sophism</w> influenced the development of moral relativism.
In older texts, the author refers to Islamic mysticism as <w>sophism</w>.
This rare book uses the term <w>sophism</w> to describe the spiritual practices of the Sufis.
